metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:wmi_test is properly supported.
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:wmi_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that a wmi_object with a namespace and wql is supported.

wmi_test.comment: Test that a wmi_object with a namespace and wql is supported.

wmi_object.comment: Retrieves a wmi_object with a namespace that equals 'root\cimv2' and a wql that equals 'SELECT Name FROM Win32_Process'.

wmi_state.comment: This state represents a wmi_object that has a namespace that equals 'root\cimv2', a wql equal that equals 'SELECT Name FROM Win32_Process', and a result that equals 'explorer.exe'.
